snippet: The men imported counterfeit, and sometimes dangerous, toys in an elaborate operation that law enforcement officials said operated for eight years.
abstract: Five men are arrested in Queens, charged with importing and selling counterfeit and hazardous toys from China in an elaborate operation that officials say persisted for eight years; officials trumpet case as triumph in fight to protect both children and intellectual property, and indictment also makes it clear just how hard it is to stop the flood of illegal consumer goods into United States.
lead_paragraph: The men imported counterfeit, and sometimes dangerous, toys in an elaborate operation that law enforcement officials said operated for eight years.

headline.seo: 5 From Queens Are Charged With Smuggling Toys From China
headline.main: 5 From Queens Charged in Toy-Smuggling Scheme
headline.print_headline: 5 in Queens Are Accused Of Smuggling Chinese Toys
